intro: Massonia jasminiflora, commonly known as the jasmine massonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and is often grown as an ornamental plant. Massonia jasminiflora prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas.
